name: exoscale
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing exoscale cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`exoscale` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/exoscale/terraform-provider-exoscale).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing exoscale cloud resources.

id.description: Snapshot ID.

indexPatterns.description: (can be used multiple times) Allows you to create glob style patterns and set a max number of indexes matching this pattern you want to keep. Creating indexes exceeding this value will cause the oldest one to get deleted. You could for example create a pattern looking like 'logs.?' and then create index logs.1, logs.2 etc, it will delete logs.1 once you create logs.6. Do note 'logs.?' does not apply to logs.10. Note: Setting max*index*count to 0 will do nothing and the pattern gets ignored.

indexTemplate.description: Template settings for all new indexes

ipFilters.description: Allow incoming connections from this list of CIDR address block, e.g. `["10.20.0.0/16"]

keepIndexRefreshInterval.description: Aiven automation resets index.refresh_interval to default value for every index to be sure that indices are always visible to search. If it doesn't fit your case, you can disable this by setting up this flag to true.

maxIndexCount.description: Maximum number of indexes to keep (Minimum value is `0`)
maxIndexCount.deprecationMessage: This attribute is deprecated and is ignored

recoveryBackupName.description: ❗ Name of a backup to recover from

settings.description: OpenSearch-specific settings, in json. e.g.`jsonencode({thread_pool_search_size: 64})`. Use `exo x get-dbaas-settings-opensearch` to get a list of available settings.

version.description: ❗ OpenSearch major version (`exo dbaas type show opensearch` for reference)

enabled.description: Enable or disable OpenSearch Dashboards (default: true).

maxOldSpaceSize.description: Limits the maximum amount of memory (in MiB) the OpenSearch Dashboards process can use. This sets the max*old*space_size option of the nodejs running the OpenSearch Dashboards. Note: the memory reserved by OpenSearch Dashboards is not available for OpenSearch. (default: 128).

requestTimeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for requests made by OpenSearch Dashboards towards OpenSearch (default: 30000)

maxIndexCount.description: Maximum number of indexes to keep before deleting the oldest one (Minimum value is `0`)

sortingAlgorithm.description: `alphabetical` or `creation_date`.

mappingNestedObjectsLimit.description: The maximum number of nested JSON objects that a single document can contain across all nested types. This limit helps to prevent out of memory errors when a document contains too many nested objects. (Default is 10000. Minimum value is `0`, maximum value is `100000`.)

numberOfReplicas.description: The number of replicas each primary shard has. (Minimum value is `0`, maximum value is `29`)

numberOfShards.description: The number of primary shards that an index should have. (Minimum value is `1`, maximum value is `1024`.)

interval.description: The healthcheck interval (seconds; must be between `5` and `300`; default: `10`).

mode.description: The healthcheck mode (`tcp`, `http` or `https`; may only be set at creation time).

port.description: The healthcheck target port (must be between `1` and `65535`).

strikesFail.description: The number of failed healthcheck attempts before considering the target unhealthy (must be between `1` and `20`; default: `2`).

strikesOk.description: The number of successful healthcheck attempts before considering the target healthy (must be between `1` and `20`; default: `3`).

timeout.description: The time before considering a healthcheck probing failed (seconds; must be between `2` and `60`; default: `3`).

tlsSkipVerify.description: Disable TLS certificate verification for healthcheck in `https` mode (boolean; default: `false`).

tlsSni.description: The healthcheck server name to present with SNI in `https` mode.

uri.description: The healthcheck target URI (required in `http(s)` modes).

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

id.description: The ID of this resource.

ipv6Address.description: The instance (main network interface) IPv6 address.

publicIpAddress.description: The instance (main network interface) IPv4 address.

interval.description: The healthcheck interval in seconds (default: `10`).

mode.description: The healthcheck mode (`tcp`|`http`|`https`; default: `tcp`).

retries.description: The healthcheck retries (default: `1`).

timeout.description: The healthcheck timeout (seconds; default: `5`).

tlsSni.description: The healthcheck TLS SNI server name (only if `mode` is `https`).

uri.description: The healthcheck URI (must be set only if `mode` is `http(s)`).

bearerToken.description: The optional bearer token to include in the request header

enabled.description: Whether to run the APIServer with the configured Kubernetes Audit

initialBackoff.description: The Initial Backoff to wait before sending data to the remote server (default '10s')

groupsClaim.description: An OpenID JWT claim to use as the user's group.

groupsPrefix.description: An OpenID prefix prepended to group claims.

requiredClaim.description: A map of key/value pairs that describes a required claim in the OpenID Token.

usernameClaim.description: An OpenID JWT claim to use as the user name.

usernamePrefix.description: An OpenID prefix prepended to username claims.

lowThreshold.description: The percent of disk usage before which image garbage collection is never run

minAge.description: The minimum age for an unused image before it is garbage collected (k8s duration format, eg. 1h)

exoscale:index/getNlbServiceList:getNlbS.description:
Fetch Exoscale [Network Load Balancers (NLB)](https://community.exoscale.com/product/networking/nlb/) Services.

Corresponding resource: exoscale_nlb.

## Example Usage

<!--Start PulumiCodeChooser -->
```yaml
variables:
  exampleNlbServices:
    fn::invoke:
      function: exoscale:getNlbServiceList
      arguments:
        name: my-nlb
outputs:
  # Outputs
  nlbServicesOutput: ${exampleNlbServices.services}
```
<!--End PulumiCodeChooser -->

Please refer to the examples
directory for complete configuration examples.
